snippet: As United States combat operations formally ended, many military families said they sensed they had already been forgotten.
abstract: Many American troops still remain involved with operations in Afghanistan, despite official end of war, and other soldiers and their families will continue to grapple with injuries, mental trauma and loss of loved ones; scaled-down Operation Resolute Support will continue bringing troops overseas to train and advise Afghan forces, even as sense of overall mission fades; some troops, veterans and those close to them say they already feel forgotten.

byline.contributor: Andy Lehren contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: As United States combat operations formally ended, many military families said they sensed they had already been forgotten.

headline.main: Mission Ends in Afghanistan, but Sacrifices Are Not Over for U.S. Soldiers
headline.print_headline: Mission Ends, but Sacrifices are Not Over

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
